dict.string: Slash: Swing your sword in an arc dealing 1d6 + [STR] damage to enemies in front of you.
The horizontal sweeping motion makes this sword effective against multiple enemies.
Cover: Raise your shield over an ally standing next to you. They gain the benefits of the shield while they remain near you.
Medium metal shield. Decorated with a tower, the symbol of protection.
Stab: Thrust at your opponent dealing 1d6 + [DEX] damage to an enemy.
Highly effective when attacking from behind. Roll an extra 1d4 if attacking from behind.
Cleave: Cleave an opponent dealing 1d10 + [STR] damage to an enemy.
Powerful attack due to its weight, but one wrong swing leaves the wielder wide open.
Shoot: Fire an arrow at your opponent dealing 1d6 + [DEX] to an enemy.
Smack: Hit one enemy for 1d4 damage.
Enhances the power of your spells. Roll an additional 1d4 damage when casting a spell.
Smack: Hit one enemy for 1d4 damage.
Improves chance to hit with miracles. Add 1 to your attack rolls when casting miracles.
Mask of sinners. They hide their faces, stifle their voices and hide in the shadows.
Smash: Hit one target for 1d6 + [STR] damage.
Iron hammer with a protrusive pommel. Standard weapon for clerics.
Slice: Hit one target for 2d4 + [STR] damage.
An accessible sword which inflicts consistent damage
Cover: Raise your shield over an ally standing next to you. They gain the benefits of the shield while they remain near you.
Conjure: Fires an arrow shaped bolt of magic dealing 1d4 + [INT] damage.
Soul arrows inflict magic damage, making them effective against iron armor, tough scales, and other physically resilient materials.
Push: Knock an enemy to the ground with your shield. Deals 1d4 damage.
Reduces physical damage received by 1 and prevents poison.
Shield of the savage mountain bandits. Uniquely-shaped with a large black spider etched upon it.
Slash: Swing your sword in an arc dealing 1d6 + [STR] to up to two enemies in front of you.
A quick and efficient sword useful for hit and run tactics.
Pray: Creates a concussive blast in front of you, knocking smaller enemies backwards.
Can only be used when a talisman is equipped.
They say at the Bridge of DÃ¼n, a single cleric fought a legion of knights with only his prayers, their bodies found at the bottom.
Key to the iron bars on the east side of the second floor of the North Undead Asylum.
The Undead Asylum is a giant Undead prison, segmented by countless iron bars. Even if an Undead were to escape from a cell, passage to the outside world would not be gained easily.
Key to the inner door of the Undead Asylum main hall.
Big key belonging to a chosen Undead pilgrim. But this chosen Undead knows not what this pilgrimage has in store.
Key to the dungeon of the Undead Asylum to the North.

A mysterious knight, without saying a word, shoved a corpse down into the cell, and on its person was this key. Who was this knight? And what was his purpose? There may be no answer, but one must still forge ahead.
A green bottle of unknown make. Fill it with fire at a bonfire, and drink from it to restore HP.
An emerald flask, from the Keeper's soul She lives to protect the flame, And dies to protect it further.
A green bottle of unknown make. Fill it with fire at a bonfire, and drink from it to restore HP.
An emerald flask, from the Keeper's soul She lives to protect the flame, And dies to protect it further.
Thrust: Stab an enemy for 2d4 + [STR]. If the enemy is wearing armor, add 5 damage.
A long-hilted spear with a barbed point. Long reach, and can be used with shield up. Effective against hard exteriors.
Cleave: Cleave any adjacent enemies for 2d8 + 2 * [STR]. Chance to knock an enemy down when struck.
As the name suggests, the Zweihander is held with two hands, but its wielder must still be inhumanly strong. It is this great weight that sends foes flying when hit solidly.
Increases attack and damage rolls for ranged weapons by 2.
This mystical ring was created in a sacrificial rite of Velka, the Goddess of Sin.
This blue tearstone from Catarina boosts the defence of its wearer when in danger.
Slash: Swing downward causing 2d6 + [DEX] damage to an enemy.
Causes 2 additional bleed damage every time the enemy moves until it dies.
Katana forged in an Eastern land. Known for its brisk slashing motions. The Uchigatana cuts beautifully and causes bleeding, but its blade is easily nicked.
Cover: Raise your shield over an ally standing next to you. They gain the benefits of the shield while they remain near you.
Reduces physical damage received by 3. Prevents fire damage while covering.
Shield of the Black Knights that wander Lordran. A flowing canal is chiseled deeply into its face.
Slash: Swing your sword in an arc dealing 3d6 + [STR] to up to two enemies in front of you.
Deals an extra 1d6 damage when used against demons.
Greatsword of the black knights who wander Lordran. Used to face chaos demons.
Throw at an enemy to deal 3d6 fire damage.
Bisque urn filled with black powder. Explodes, inflicting fire damage. Many warriors use these to augment their strategic repertoire.
This universal key opens any basic lock. Tool of the trade for thieves.
But in the cursed land of the Undead, most doors are left unopened.
Conjure: Fires an spear shaped bolt of magic dealing 1d8 + [INT] damage. Lose 1 health.
Forms a magical spear to pierce using your own blood as a catalyst.
How else do you achieve power without a little blood, sweat, and tears?
